_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:18:55 using v2.3
title: How has the proportion of outpatients warned of danger signals changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of outpatients who reported not being warned about danger signals upon returning home has decreased from 36% in 2003 to 33% in 2011. However, 54% of outpatients reported not being completely warned about danger signals to watch out for in 2011. In general the proportion of patients being completely warned about danger signals is higher in outpatient departments than inpatients.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Outpatient Services
